p: The new genomes reported here were obtained from different cellular compartments of two CHIKV infected patients ( Table 1). As reported in a previous study, blood, saliva and urine may also be used for the diagnosis of CHIKV infection, and the chances of detection are greatest when sampling occurs during the first week after the onset of symptoms [ 26]. These findings are particularly important for the genomic surveillance of arbovirus in regions with limited logistic structure, especially when the collection of blood samples, which is preferred, is not possible.
